The Iron Mountains or Ered Engrin were an immense mountain range in the north
column2: stretching across Middle-earth from east to west. In the west it bent north a hundred leagues from reaching Helcaraxë.

column1: Of old the Iron Mountains came close to touching the Blue Mountains (Ered Luin) in the West to the Red Mountains (Orocarni) of the East
column2: but in the wars between the Valar and Morgoth the mountain range was distorted.

column1: Melkors great fortresses of Angband and Utumno were built in the mountains. North of the range lay the regions of ever-lasting cold.
